examples: I cannot accept the dogma of this church
accept an argument

definitions.text: receive willingly something given or offered
examples: The only girl who would have him was the miller's daughter
I won't have this dog in my house!
Please accept my present

definitions.text: give an affirmative reply to; respond favorably to
examples: I cannot accept your invitation
I go for this resolution

definitions.text: react favorably to; consider right and proper
examples: People did not accept atonal music at that time
We accept the idea of universal health care

definitions.text: admit into a group or community
examples: accept students for graduate study
We'll have to vote on whether or not to admit a new member

definitions.text: take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person
examples: I'll accept the charges
She agreed to bear the responsibility
I shall have to accept these unpleasant working conditions
I swallowed the insult
She has learned to live with her husband's little idiosyncrasies

definitions.text: be designed to hold or take
examples: This surface will not take the dye

definitions.text: receive (a report) officially, as from a committee
make use of or accept for some purpose
examples: take a risk
take an opportunity

definitions.text: be sexually responsive to, used of a female domesticated mammal
examples: The cow accepted the bull
